title: Rumored Resident Evil 0 Remake Will Flesh Out Original's Story - Report

                The existence of a long-rumored remake of Capcom's Resident Evil 0 is now looking even more likely, with a new report corroborating not only that its existence but also new details about the game's cast and story.As reported by MP1st, the rumored remake of the 2002-prequel is officially being referred to within Capcom as project "Chamber," seemingly a reference to the game's main protagonist Rebecca Chambers. The game has reportedly been in development for several years, with performance-capture work starting sometime in 2024.

That same "Chamber" codename appears on the resume of actor Jon McLaren, known for playing Star Lord in Square Enix's 2021 Guardians of the Galaxy game. His resume lists "Project Chamber" as his most recent video game project, labeling it as an upcoming AAA game in which he plays a lead character. He also lists the project as coming from the motion-capture company Beyond Capture Studios. It's that same motion capture studio that has worked with Capcom on games like Street Fighter 6 and the Resident Evil 4 remake.While it's not confirmed who McLaren is playing in the remake, it's likely Billy Coen, the male lead in Resident Evil 0 who aids Chambers in her mission to uncover more about a zombie outbreak on the outskirts of Raccoon City.Resident Evil 0's opening hours take place on a zombie-infested train, and according to MP1st, the remake will more fully flesh out various plot details and characters only alluded to in the original. That includes making the train's conductor a full-fledged character that interacts with Chambers and Coen rather than only being referenced like in the original.As for when the Resident Evil 0 remake will arrive, it's likely still a few years away. A recent statement from frequent Capcom leaker DuskGolem points towards the Resident Evil 0 remake not releasing until 2028, with another rumored remake, Code Veronica, set for 2027. Neither remake has been officially announced by Capcom.The next mainline entry in the series, Resident Evil Requiem, is coming February 27, 2026. It stars the daughter of Resident Evil Outbreak's Alyssa Ashcroft, and will finally return the franchise to Raccoon City.

                                                                                                                                                               We still have to get through Halloween and Thanksgiving--but for some people, it's never to early to start looking ahead to the holiday season. And to help you count down the remaining days, you'll find the adorable Pokemon Holiday Calendar 2025 available at Amazon for $50. It's loaded with collectible figurines and accessories, giving you a fun new toy to discover every day leading up to Christmas. There's also a spooky Pokemon Halloween Calendar for $35--and it's not too late to check it out.                                 Pokemon Holiday Calendar 2025                                                                $50                                                                                                                                                                                    The Pokemon Holiday Calendar 2025 features 16 two-inch action figures, plus eight accessories. Several are dressed up for the holidays, such as Pikachu with a Christmas hat, Bulbasaur with garland, and Squirtle with winter gloves and a matching hat. As for the accessories, these are things like a Christmas tree, pastry cabinet, or tiny dining chairs and tables.                      Pokemon Holiday Calendar 2025 - Squirtle, Bulbasaur, PikachuFor a holiday calendar that's a bit different, check out the Mega Construx Pokemon Holiday Calendar. This has you building a new Pokemon-inspired item every day, including an adorable Pikachu sporting a Christmas hat. The entire set clocks in at 202 pieces--so it's a great choice for young Pokemon fans or novice builders. Another official Pokemon product, the Pokemon Halloween Calendar 2025, is also available at Amazon. It features 13 days of reveals, including eight two-inch figures, two three-inch figures, a large 4.5-inch figure, and five accessories. Its packaging glows in the dark, too, making it a spooky display piece leading up to Halloween.If you'd rather pick up a bunch of Pokemon TCG cards, the Pokemon TCG: Holiday Calendar is worth a look. Here's a look at everything it includes:8 foil Pokemon TCG cards with festive stamps6 Pokemon TCG booster packs7 Pokemon TCG 3-card fun packs2 Pokemon coins2 Pokemon sticker sheetsCode for Pokemon TCG LivePokemon Holiday CalendarsMega Construx Pokemon Holiday Calendar -- $25Pokemon Halloween Calendar 2025 -- $35Pokemon Holiday Calendar 2025 -- $50Pokemon TCG: Holiday Calendar -- $63 ($75)And, of course, Pokemon Legends: Z-A is now available on Switch and Switch 2.
